title: Are HP Proliant DL380 servers good? - Quora

response.answer_text: I serviced HP Proliant servers for about 8 years as a field tech for HP. I would occasionally get that question when I was working on a customer’s server. My answer: “It’s hard to say. Everyone I’ve ever seen has been broken.” The DL380 is probably the most popular version in the Proliant series. In my current job I support about 95 Proliant DL 380s. They just work. In the last two years I’ve replaced one system board and maybe 7 or 8 hot-swappable hard drives. The batteries for the cache module (BBWC) can stop charging after a few years so I’ve replaced 3 or 4 of those, and my company likes to upgrade the cache module at the same time the battery is replaced. But maintenance wise, that’s about it. I find the DL380’s to be solid and reliable and if I had my own business I wouldn’t hesitate to fill my racks with them.
